intro: Ozoroa stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ozoroa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Ozoroa stenophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
